title: Above & Beyond Reunite With Justine Suissa for Poetic Single, "Bigger Than All Of Us"
description: The iconic trance trio return with the soul-stirring titular track of their first studio album in seven years.
author: Cameron Sunkel

html:
The iconic trance trio return with the soul-stirring titular track of their first studio album in seven years.

The iconic trance trio return with the soul-stirring titular track of their first studio album in seven years.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

Above & Beyond have reunited with longtime collaborator Justine Suissa for "Bigger Than All Of Us," the title track from their first studio album in seven years.

The track itself blooms as Suissa’s vocals float atop shimmering synths, gentle shaker rhythms and echoes of reverberant percussion that ripple out like distant bells.

Explaining its production, Above & Beyond's Jono Grant said: "It’s a very simple track in terms of its instrumentation, but it’s got quite a lot in it in terms of the arrangement. It’s got a middle eight section, which is quite common in more classic song structures, and usually doesn’t appear in clubbier tunes."

When the iconic dance music trio set about collecting the stories that would define this next chapter, the song’s essence proved impossible to ignore. That became increasingly clear after reuniting with Suissa, with whom they released "Almost Home" back in 2021.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

"She tends to write pretty fast, and her words come together pretty quickly,” Grant said of Suissa." Those words speak to the power of unity, a theme that has consistently underscored the group’s most beloved work.

You can listen to "Bigger Than All Of Us" below and find the new single on streaming services here. Above & Beyond's album of the same name is scheduled to release July 18th, 2025, via their own Anjunabeats label.
